::: {.Exercise data-latex=""}

A quel volume doit-on diluer 50 [ml] de H~2~SO~4~ 3.5 [M] pour obtenir une solution de H~2~SO~4~ 2 [M]?
\vspace{\stretch{1}}

:::

::: {.Answer data-latex=""}

$$
\begin{split}
  C_1 \cdot V_1 = C_2 \cdot V_2
\end{split}
\qquad
\begin{split}
  V_2 &= \frac{C_1 \cdot V_1}{C_2} \\
  &= \frac{3.5\ [M] \cdot 50 \cdot 10^{-3}\ [l] }{2\ [M]} \\
  &= 0.0875\ [l] = 87.5\ [ml]
\end{split}
$$

:::
